prerequisites.p: Before you can compile this manual, you will need to:

ul.li: Download and install the Microsoft HTML Help Workshop.
Realize, the download will take a half hour or so using a 56K modem with no competing traffic.

steps.p: Here are the steps for compiling this manual:
steps.step: Open the three TestHelp.hh* files in the file control system for editing so they can be deleted and rebuilt by the batch file.
Double click the HelpFiles\TestHelp.hhp file to launch the Microsoft HTML Help Workshop.
Verify the project files in the left pane.
Click the TOC and Index tabs to verify the names and indentation of those entries.
Click the diskette icon at the bottom to save the TOC in its own HTML format.
Sort the index by clicking the sort button near the bottom of the control column to the left of the index list.

Click the compile button at the bottom left of the left pane.
If some files don't compile, check their paths in the project file, [OPTIONS] and {FILES} sections, and try to compile again. If source XML files were copied to create new ones, then it is likely the file name in the source XML file is wrong.

label.name: Postcompilation
label.p: Each time the help file is created, it should be tested randomly to see that links, Table of Contents, Index and Searching works.
Mailto links will work if a default mail program is set in Windows. Links to the SIL intranet work only if there is a web connection.
